question: Which of the following is true regarding Naegleria fowleri is commonly acquired by?
exp: Naegleria fowleri (brain eating amoeba) infection is commonly acquired by swimming in fresh water pond.Infective form- trophozoitesThey can penetrate the nasal mucosa and cribriform plate to produce a purulent meningitis and encephalitis that are usually rapidly fatal.

question: A HIV positive individual having diarrheal episodes stool examination reveals on oocyst of size 8-10 Micron, what could be the diagnosis?
exp: Parasites Size of oocyst Cryptosporidium parvum 4-6 micron Cyclospora 8-10 micron Isospora 23-36 micron They all are acid fast so the appear similar in colour under acid fast stain. So, size of oocyst is used to identify them.

question: Winter bottom sign is seen in:
exp: Winter bottom sign is enlargement of posterior cervical lymph nodes, seen in sleeping sickness. Sleeping sickness, also known as African trypanosomiasis is caused by Trypanosoma brucei gambiense and Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense. T. brucei gambiense causes West African sleeping sickness manifested by fever, hepatosplenomegaly and posterior cervical lymphadenopathy with chronic central nervous system invasion. T. brucei rhodesiense causes East African sleeping sickness manifested by fever, early and acute central nervous system invasion, with loss of weight and myocarditis. South American trypanosomiasis (Chagas disease) is caused by T. cruzi

question: Ingested RBCs (Erythrophagy) seen in:
exp: Erythrophagocytosis (engulfed RBC inside trophozoites) is confirmatory of E. histolytica.Infective form of E. histolytica- Quadrinucleate cyst.

question: In Toxoplasmosis , the oocyst and pseudocyst are respectively seen in :
exp: Toxoplasmosis Cat -Enteric cycle occurs-Oocyst formed Man-Pseudocysts (Tissue cysts) contain slowly dividing forms called bradyzoites.(no oocyst formation) Tachyzoites are crescent shaped trophozoites.

question: All of the following have operculated eggs except:
exp: Operculated eggs are those eggs which have a lid or operculum.Operculated eggs are present in-1. Most of the Trematodes (except Schistosomes)2. Diphyllobothrium latum (Fish tapeworm)Diphyllobothrium latum causes Megaloblastic anemia.Eggs of H. dimunita (Rat tapeworm) lacks polar filaments. Clonorchis sinensi (Oriental Liver fluke) causes Cholangiocarcinoma.

question: Ziemans dots are seen in:
exp: Plasmodium malariae- ZOOM* Z- Ziemann's dots* OO- Old age RBCs* M- Maximum Incubation period * It is associated with nephrotic syndrome.* Band forms are present Schuffners dots - P. vivaxMaurer dots- P. falciparumJames dots- P. ovale

question: A Sabin Feldman test is used for the diagnosis of:
exp: Sabin Feldman dye test is positive for toxoplasmosis. It is a complement fixation test. This test is based on specific inhibition by antibodies of the staining of trophozoite by alkaline methylene blue.If antibodies are present ,Toxoplasma trophozoites are not stained which indicates positive result.If there are no antibodies, trophozoites with intact membrane are stained and appear blue under microscope

question: All the following spread by auto infection except:
exp: Parasites causing autoinfection are(C2HEST)C- Capillaria philippinensisCryptosporidium parvumH- Hymenolepis nanaE- Enterobius vermicularisS- Strongyloides stercoralisT- Taenia solium(Pork tapeworm) Taenia solium have proglottids responsible for causing autoinfection.
